cell.html: Killed in a street brawl. The assailants were charged with manslaughter but acquitted. [12]
cell.text: Killed in a street brawl. The assailants were charged with manslaughter but acquitted. [12]

cell.html: Found dead on the floor of a lavatory at King's Cross station with his throat cut and a blood-stained knife by his side. [13]
cell.text: Found dead on the floor of a lavatory at King's Cross station with his throat cut and a blood-stained knife by his side. [13]

cell.html: Somerset history maintains Hardy committed suicide rather than be sent back to the WW1 battlefields [14]
cell.text: Somerset history maintains Hardy committed suicide rather than be sent back to the WW1 battlefields [14]

cell.html: Found dead in his flat in New Delhi in suspicious circumstances. [15]
cell.text: Found dead in his flat in New Delhi in suspicious circumstances. [15]

cell.html: Believed to have died from Guillain-Barre syndrome , but post mortem suggested that he was poisoned [16]
cell.text: Believed to have died from Guillain-Barre syndrome , but post mortem suggested that he was poisoned [16]

cell.html: Died of head injuries after a brawl outside a Melbourne pub. There were claims that it was murder, but the charge that was brought was manslaughter and the person charged was found not guilty [17]
cell.text: Died of head injuries after a brawl outside a Melbourne pub. There were claims that it was murder, but the charge that was brought was manslaughter and the person charged was found not guilty [17]

cell.html: Found dead in his hotel room in Kingston , Jamaica during the 2007 cricket World Cup . Originally believed to have been strangled but the investigation returned an open verdict, neither ruling out strangulation or death by natural causes [18]
cell.text: Found dead in his hotel room in Kingston , Jamaica during the 2007 cricket World Cup . Originally believed to have been strangled but the investigation returned an open verdict, neither ruling out strangulation or death by natural causes [18]

cell.html: Woolmer, a former Test cricketer, was the coach of the Pakistan cricket team at the time of his death
cell.text: Woolmer, a former Test cricketer, was the coach of the Pakistan cricket team at the time of his death

context.text: List of cricketers who were murdered - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Player Circumstances of death Date of death Notes Player Profile
List of cricketers who were murdered
This is a chronological list of cricketers who have played in first class cricket , List A , or at a similar level, who were murdered . This does not include those who were killed in wars .
List of cricketers who were murdered

entity.htmlSnippet:
PlayerCircumstances of deathDate of deathNotesPlayer Profile
1Jack MarshKilled in a street brawl. The assailants were charged with manslaughter but acquitted. [12]25 May 1916[11]
2Percy HardyFound dead on the floor of a lavatory at King's Cross station with his throat cut and a blood-stained knife by his side. [13]March 9, 1916Somerset history maintains Hardy committed suicide rather than be sent back to the WW1 battlefields [14][12]
3Rajesh PeterFound dead in his flat in New Delhi in suspicious circumstances. [15]16 November 1995[13]
4Tertius BoschBelieved to have died from Guillain-Barre syndrome, but post mortem suggested that he was poisoned [16]February 14, 2000[14]
5David HookesDied of head injuries after a brawl outside a Melbourne pub. There were claims that it was murder, but the charge that was brought was manslaughter and the person charged was found not guilty [17]January 9, 2004[15]
6Bob WoolmerFound dead in his hotel room in Kingston, Jamaica during the 2007 cricket World Cup. Originally believed to have been strangled but the investigation returned an open verdict, neither ruling out strangulation or death by natural causes[18]March 18, 2007Woolmer, a former Test cricketer, was the coach of the Pakistan cricket team at the time of his death[16]
